theme.content:
Based on the research, here are the three major green projects in Dijon:
1. Green Hydrogen Production Station (sustainable transport)
2. OnDijon Smart City Initiative (energy management)
3. Elithis Energy-Positive Tower (sustainable architecture)

For the first item's theme: Renewable energies
theme.instruction: Enter the environmental theme of the project

category.instruction: Enter the category of the green project

description.content: Green hydrogen production and distribution station for public transport fleet, reducing CO2 emissions by 1,200 tonnes annually and converting all buses and 73% of refuse vehicles to decarbonized energy by 2035
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the green project
description.example: Deployment of photovoltaic panels on the roofs of public buildings (Anjou and Buffon school groups, Gymnasium, Fontaine d'Ouche stadium, etc.).

investment.instruction: Enter the investment amount for the green project

theme.instruction: Enter the environmental theme of the project

category.instruction: Enter the category of the green project

description.content: Centralized control center managing urban equipment including street lighting, traffic signals, and public transportation, achieving 65% energy savings through LED lighting renovations and building connectivity
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the green project
description.example: 367km of cycle paths and replacement of tractors and combustion-powered vehicles in the municipal fleet with electric vehicles

investment.instruction: Enter the investment amount for the green project

theme.instruction: Enter the environmental theme of the project

category.instruction: Enter the category of the green project

description.content: Elithis Tower produces more energy than it consumes through solar panels and innovative design, setting standards for sustainable urban architecture
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the green project
description.example: 367km of cycle paths and replacement of tractors and combustion-powered vehicles in the municipal fleet with electric vehicles

investment.instruction: Enter the investment amount for the green project

theme.content:
Based on the search results, here are the three distinct social projects for Dijon:

["Age-friendly Programme", "OnDijon Smart City Project", "FAASST-NZ Climate Action Initiative"]

For the specific theme of item 1 (Age-friendly Programme):

Social inclusion of elderly residents
theme.instruction: Enter the social theme of the project

category.content:
Based on the information from my previous search about the Age-friendly Programme in Dijon, the appropriate category would be:

Elderly care services
category.instruction: Enter the category of the social project

description.content:
Based on the previous search results about the Age-friendly Programme in Dijon:

Comprehensive program launched in 2009 featuring La Maison des séniors (dedicated senior center opened in 2013), urban accessibility improvements (lowered curbs, added benches, public toilets), and seniors' restaurant initiative for group meals to combat social isolation.
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the social project
description.example: Major multiyear renovation plan for Dijon's 76 schools: budget of 75M€ including: 30M€ over 10 years for renovation and modernization, 36.7M€ to remove prefal and 4.3M€ to renovate school grounds and surroundings, e.g. Anjou nursery school (beautificatio of school interiors; Beaumarchais elementary school: renovation of sanitar facilities; Dampierre elementary school: replacement of ground-floor woodwork; Flammarion gymnasium and ALSH schoo groups: partial interior renovation, installation of roller shutters and roof repairs; Coteaux du Suzon, Plein Air and Ouest elementary school groups: renovation of flat roofs; Darcy school group: renovation of préau...).

investment.instruction: Enter the investment amount for the social project

theme.instruction: Enter the social theme of the project

category.instruction: Enter the category of the social project

description.content: Centralized control center managing urban equipment including traffic lights, public lighting, and CCTV cameras, with improved coordination of city services like road works and waste collection, plus development of new digital public services for residents and participative democracy initiatives.
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the social project
description.example: Major multiyear renovation plan for Dijon's 76 schools: budget of 75M€ including: 30M€ over 10 years for renovation and modernization, 36.7M€ to remove prefal and 4.3M€ to renovate school grounds and surroundings, e.g. Anjou nursery school (beautificatio of school interiors; Beaumarchais elementary school: renovation of sanitar facilities; Dampierre elementary school: replacement of ground-floor woodwork; Flammarion gymnasium and ALSH schoo groups: partial interior renovation, installation of roller shutters and roof repairs; Coteaux du Suzon, Plein Air and Ouest elementary school groups: renovation of flat roofs; Darcy school group: renovation of préau...).

investment.instruction: Enter the investment amount for the social project

theme.instruction: Enter the social theme of the project

category.instruction: Enter the category of the social project

description.content: FAASST-NZ pilot project (2023-2025) focusing on reducing emissions from urban mobility and buildings, which account for 76% of Dijon's CO2 emissions, through creation of a Massification Operator and multi-stakeholder governance approach to address systemic barriers in decarbonizing vehicles and buildings.
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the social project
description.example: Major multiyear renovation plan for Dijon's 76 schools: budget of 75M€ including: 30M€ over 10 years for renovation and modernization, 36.7M€ to remove prefal and 4.3M€ to renovate school grounds and surroundings, e.g. Anjou nursery school (beautificatio of school interiors; Beaumarchais elementary school: renovation of sanitar facilities; Dampierre elementary school: replacement of ground-floor woodwork; Flammarion gymnasium and ALSH schoo groups: partial interior renovation, installation of roller shutters and roof repairs; Coteaux du Suzon, Plein Air and Ouest elementary school groups: renovation of flat roofs; Darcy school group: renovation of préau...).

theme.content:
For the array of green projects:
1. Green hydrogen production facility for public transport
2. Odivea water and wastewater management system
3. Smart city energy efficiency program

For the specific theme request: Waste management and recovery
theme.instruction: Enter the environmental theme of the inter-municipality project

category.content:
Based on the previous search results, I'll first confirm the three main green projects:

["Green hydrogen production facility for public transport", "Odivea water and wastewater management system", "Smart city energy efficiency program"]

For item 1's category: Clean transport and renewable energy
category.instruction: Enter the category of the inter-municipality green project
category.example: Collection and sorting of household and similar waste (HHW) and treatment of household and similar waste (DMA)

description.content:
For the green hydrogen production facility project, based on the previous search results:

€100 million project to establish hydrogen production and distribution stations, converting city buses and 73% of refuse collection vehicles to hydrogen power, reducing CO2 emissions by 1,200 tonnes annually (equivalent to 10 million kilometers of city car travel).
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the inter-municipality green project
description.example:
Acquisition of household waste skips, upgrading of sorting center PPI of €21 M
Deployment of the hydrogen production and distribution station with the 1st refuse collection vehicle + start-up of operations at the North station (Valmy)
Modernization of the sorting center (€2 million in 2024 and a PPI total of €29 million).
Project to modernize the waste-to-energy plant.

investment.instruction: Enter the investment amount for the inter-municipality green project

theme.instruction: Enter the environmental theme of the inter-municipality project

category.instruction: Enter the category of the inter-municipality green project
category.example: Collection and sorting of household and similar waste (HHW) and treatment of household and similar waste (DMA)

description.content: Creation of Odivea, France's first multiservice SEMOP managing both drinking water and wastewater services, with plans to produce green gas through methanation from reused sludge at Eauvitale wastewater treatment plant, generating 10 GWh of biomethane annually for the metropole's gas network.
description.instruction: Provide a detailed description of the inter-municipality green project
description.example:
Acquisition of household waste skips, upgrading of sorting center PPI of €21 M
Deployment of the hydrogen production and distribution station with the 1st refuse collection vehicle + start-up of operations at the North station (Valmy)
Modernization of the sorting center (€2 million in 2024 and a PPI total of €29 million).
Project to modernize the waste-to-energy plant.

name.instruction: Enter the full name of the contact person

title.instruction: Enter the professional title of the contact person

title_since.instruction: Enter the date when the person started in this title

birth_date.instruction: Enter the birth date of the contact person

birth_place.instruction: Enter the birth place of the contact person

education.instruction: List the educational background of the contact person
example: Master's degree in public law and sports management from the University of Burgundy (1999)
Bachelor's degree in public administration, Université Paris I Panthéon-Assas (2005)
Institute for Public Management and Economic Development (IGPDE) (2006)

activities.instruction: List the professional activities of the contact person
example: 1st Vice-President of Dijon Métropole in charge of soft mobility, the bicycle plan, the European Green Capital, relations with the Département (since September 2024)

career.instruction: List the career history of the contact person
example: Former French champion in 5,000 m canoe-kayak (1998)
Deputy mayor of Dijon, responsible for trade, crafts and the Cour de ville project, then local democracy (2008-2014)
Lecturer in Master 2 at the Faculty of Sports, University of Burgundy (2010-2014)
1st Deputy Mayor of Dijon, responsible for ecological transition, climate and the environment (2014-2024)
Acting Mayor of Dijon (July 27-August 10, 2015)

name.instruction: Enter the full name of the contact person

title.instruction: Enter the professional title of the contact person
title.example: Chairman of the Dijon Metropolitan Council

title_since.instruction: Enter the date when the person started in this title

birth_date.instruction: Enter the birth date of the contact person

birth_place.instruction: Enter the birth place of the contact person

education.instruction: List the educational background of the contact person
example: Master's degree in public law
DESS in Economics
DEA in Political Science

activities.instruction: List the professional activities of the contact person
example: Chairman, CNER (Fédération des agences d'attractivité, de développement et d'innovation) (since May 2023)

career.instruction: List the career history of the contact person
example: Chargé de mission to the prefect of the Burgundy region (1979-1981)
Chargé de mission in the office of Pierre Joxe, then chief of staff to André Billardon, Chairman of the Burgundy Regional Council (1981-1984)
Chief of Staff to Pierre Joxe, Minister of the Interior and Decentralization (1984-1986)
General Delegate of the Association of Progressive and Socialist Regional Councils (1986-1988)
Technical advisor to Pierre Joxe, Minister of the Interior (1988-1991)
Dijon city councillor (1989-2001)
Deputy Chief of Staff to Laurent Fabius (1991-1992) and Henri Emmanuelli (1992-1993), Presidents of the French National Assembly
Sous-préfet hors-cadre on secondment, project manager at the Fondation Jean-Jaurès (1993-1999)
Burgundy regional councillor (1994-2001)
PS National Secretary, in charge of organization and coordination (1997-2005)
Member of the PS national office
General Councillor for Côte-d'Or, Dijon 5 canton (1998-2008)
Technical advisor to Jean-Jack Queyranne, Minister for Relations with Parliament (2000-2001)
Chairman, Dijon Regional Council (2001-2014)
Mayor of Dijon (2001-2014)
Vice-Chairman, AMF (Association des maires de France)
Chairman of the Côte-d'Or Mayors Association (2001-2014)
PS National Secretary, in charge of coordination (2005-2008)
Senator for Côte-d'Or (2008-2014)
Chairman of the Socialist Group in the French Senate (2011-2014)

Minister of Labor, Employment and Social Dialogue in Manuel Valls' first government (April 2014 to August 2014), then Minister of Labor, Employment, Vocational Training and Social Dialogue (August 2014 to August 2015)
Chairman of the Communauté d'agglomération, then the Communauté urbaine du Grand Dijon (August 2014-2017)
Mayor of Dijon (2015-Nov. 2024)
Chairman, FNSER (Fédération nationale des élus socialistes et républicains) (March 2016-Sept. 2021)
